title: Love Island star Bethany Rogers will stand trial accused of using illegal cash to buy an Audi A3
text:
Former Love Island contestant Bethany Rogers is to stand trial for allegedly using thousands of pounds of illegal money to buy high performance cars.

The 23 year old, who starred in the 2015 ITV2 show, appeared at Bradford Crown Court Friday morning alongside her co-accused Laurence Edwards.

She spoke only to confirm her name and deny the charges against her.

Rogers, of Gomersal and Edwards, 28, of Burley-in-Wharfedale, near Bradford, West Yorkshire are said to have used dirty cash in buying and selling cars.

Former Love Island contestant Bethany Rogers leaves Bradford Crown Court Friday morning after appearing alongside her co accused Laurence Edwards

During the 10 minute hearing at Bradford Crown Court, the pair exchanged whispers in the dock as a trial date was fixed, after both pleaded not guilty to a total of eight counts.

Mum of one Rogers faces two charges. The first is that she knowingly possessed criminal property, namely cash, between 1 April 2015 and 24 April 2017 after Edwards credited her bank account.

The second is that she's accused of converting criminal property, namely £16,500 in cash, in the purchase of an Audi A3, from VW Stockport, in June 2016.

Rogers starred in ITV2's Love Island in 2015 (pictured above)

Mum of one Rogers (pictured above) faces two charges. The first is that she knowingly possessed criminal property, namely cash, between 1 April 2015 and 24 April 2017 after Edwards credited her bank account. The second is that she's accused of converting criminal property, namely £16,500 in cash, in the purchase of an Audi A3, from VW Stockport, in June 2016

Edwards denies having £49,772.72 of criminal cash between April 2015 and January 2018.

He also pleaded not guilty to converting £25,500 in cash in buying a Mercedes A45 from Aston Martin in Brentwood in November 2016.

He also denies converting criminal property in November 2017 by part exchanging the Mercedes for an Audi RS3 at AK Performance Car Sales.

Edwards also denies doing an act intending to pervert the course of justice by selling the Mercedes A45 when it was subject to a restraint order.

He is further charged with another count of perverting the course of justice in January 2018 by reporting to police that the Mercedes A45 has been stolen in a burglary.

Finally, Edwards denies possessing £4,925 in cash between April 2015 and January 2018, knowing it stemmed from criminal, activity.

Both Rogers and Edwards will stand trial together on May 4, next year.

Judge Jonathan Gibson told them the trial will last three to four days and if they fail to attend they will be tried in their absence.
description: Rogers is accused of using dirty cash in buying and selling cars. She appeared at Bradford Crown Court on Friday and pleaded not guilty.
